Tool Description:
a fastening device used to hold or secure objects tightly together to prevent movement or separation through the application of inward pressure. There are many types of clamps available for many different purposes. Some are temporary, as used to position components while fixing them together, others are intended to be permanent.
Operation:
adjust the clamp to thickness of the materials being clamped together with enough space to be able to easily slide it on and off. Place the clamp in the position in which you wish to clamp and proceed to tighten the clamp using the clamps method of tightening, ie. turning, squeezing, etc.
